citeinfo.title: GeoSpecies data

citeinfo.origin: Please refer to Dataset Point of Contact.
citeinfo.title: Please refer to the Projects table in the Landscape Data Commons database.

descript.abstract: This dataset includes plot level plant species indicators including occurrence (from Species inventory), cover (from Line-point intercept), height (from Vegetation height). Reference(s): Herrick, J.E., J. Van Zee, S.E. McCord, J.W. Karl, E. Courtright, and L. Burkett. 2018. The Monitoring Manual for Grassland, Shrubland, and Savanna Ecosystems. USDA-ARS.
descript.purpose: This dataset should be used to determine plant species occurrence, cover, and height within a given plot.

idinfo.accconst: Please refer to the Projects table in the Landscape Data Commons database.

procstep.procdesc: Indicators calculated using the terradactyl R package. https://github.com/Landscape-Data-Commons/terradactyl.

attr.attrdef: Code denoting original database information about the project.
Unique identifier of the broader project under which data were collected.
The plant species code found on a plot in the Species Inventory, Vegetation Height, or Line-point Intercept method.
The percent foliar cover of the species code found in the Species field in the plot. This indicator is derived from the Line-point Intercept method.
The count of hits of the species code found in the Species field in the plot. This indicator is derived from the Line-point Intercept method.
Average height in cm of the species code found in the Species field in the plot. This indicator is derived from the Vegetation Height method.

The count of measurements that were used to calculate the Hgt_Species_Avg. Measurements will be dropped in any instance where a species was measured as a Non-woody or Woody height but the code in the species list is the opposite Growth Habit (Woody or Non-woody). Heights where a species code was recorded but the height = 0 are not included in the height calculations.

The life length of a plant. This field contains either Perennial or Annual with Biennial plants classified as Annuals. The most common duration for each plant was determined by local botany expertise often after consulting the USDA plants database.

This field contains the broader lifeform of a plant either Woody or Non-woody. This is determined by the GrowthHabitSub value. Forb, Graminoid, and Sedge are Non-woody and Succulent, Shrub, SubShrub, and Tree are Woody.

The lifeform of a plant in this dataset. Options are Forb, Graminoid, Sedge, Succulent, Shrub, SubShrub, Tree. The most common growth habit for each plant was determined by local botany expertise often after consulting the USDA plants database.
The identifier of the species list used to calculate indicators.
Date that the data were uploaded into Landscape Data Commons (YYYY-MM-DD).
